title: Pablo Larraín Breaks Down El Conde and Finally Facing Pinochet
description: In 'El Conde,' Pablo Larraín turns Augusto Pinochet into a 250-year-old vampire whose impact is quite literally still felt

title: Breaking Down the Ending of A Haunting in Venice—And How it Adapts a Chilling Agatha Christie Novel
description: How Kenneth Branagh's new Hercule Poirot movie adapts Agatha Christie's chilling 1969 novel 'Hallowe’en Party'

title: A Seattle Police Officer’s Jokes About an Indian Woman’s Killing Are Sparking Outrage
description: A Seattle officer's reaction to Jaahnavi Kandula's death has sparked conversations about racism, xenophobia and sexism.

title: How NASA Got a ‘UFO Czar’—And Why it Matters
description: It's an increasingly important job as sightings of unexplained craft have have soared in recent years.

title: Drew Barrymore Apologizes For Bringing Back Show During Strike–But Does Not Change Decision
description: Drew Barrymore has formally responded to the backlash she received for resuming the production of The Drew Barrymore Show amid the ongoing Writers Guild of America (WGA) and the Screen Actors Guild-American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (SAG-AFTRA) strikes in a four-minute video posted to her Instagram. “I just wanted to make a show…

title: The Long History Behind SZA and Drake’s New Single “Slime You Out”
description: Drake and SZA released a new song called "Slime You Out" today—their first ever collaboration. Here's the long history behind the song.

title: Ashton Kutcher Steps Down as Board Chair of Anti-Child-Sex-Abuse Organization
description: His move comes amid backlash over his support of Danny Masterson

title: According to a New TikTok Trend, Men Think About the Roman Empire All the Time
description: In a new TikTok trend, woman ask men how often they think about the Roman Empire. The consensus? All of the time.

title: TikTok Fined $368 Million in the E.U. for Putting Children’s Data at Risk
description: TikTok was fined $368 million in the E.U. for alleged lapses in the way it cares for children’s personal data.

title: As Climate and Trade Become Intertwined, a Bipartisan Push for Carbon Tariffs is Emerging
description: A bipartisan coalition is calling for new  tariffs on high-carbon imports, which would shape the global fight against climate change.

title: Success of MDMA in PTSD Study Could Pave the Way for U.S. Approval of the Psychedelic
description: In a study of 104 people with post-traumatic stress disorder, the psychedelic MDMA effectively reduced symptoms when used alongside talk therapy.

title: As Pandemic-Era Child Care Funding Ends, Many Families Could Suffer
description: Loss of additional federal aid could make child care even more unaffordable for parents.

title: What to Know About the Expiration of Federal Emergency Childcare Funding
description: It expires Sept. 30, raising concerns for millions of families and childcare providers.

title: Seattle Police Officer Who Joked After Woman’s Death Says Remarks Were Misunderstood
description: A body-worn camera captured a Seattle police officer joking about a woman who was killed by a police cruiser while crossing a street.

title: Ukraine Reclaims a Village in the East as Part of Counteroffensive
description: Ukrainian forces recaptured the eastern village of Andriivka in a multi-pronged counteroffensive after intense battles with Russian troops.

title: How to Stop Doomscrolling and Find Meaning on Social Media
description: Can we approach our news intake more intentionally in order to better protect ourselves online, ask Alexa Koenig and Andrea Lampros.

title: Inside the Controversy Over the National Museum of the American Latino
description: The National Museum of the American Latino doesn’t even have a building yet, but its work is already controversial.

title: It’s Rosh Hashanah. Give Yourself a Rest From Worrying
description: 'We can’t let security overwhelm the free and full expression of our religious rites,' writes Rabbi Diana Fersko.

title: Myanmar’s Anti-Democratic Junta Seeks Russia’s Help on How to Run an Election
description: Russia’s support gives the junta’s upcoming election a much-needed endorsement where it might otherwise have none.

title: We Can Prevent AI Disaster Like We Prevented Nuclear Catastrophe
description: Averting existential risk from AGI is daunting, and leaving this challenge to private companies is a dangerous gamble.

title: Popular Thai PM Candidate Pita Limjaroenrat Resigns as Leader of Move Forward Party
description: Pita Limjaroenrat’s bid to become Thailand’s prime minister was thwarted by the royalist conservative establishment.

title: China Faces a Familiar Economic Downturn. But Its Crisis Is Worsened by the War in Ukraine
description: China’s economic downturn is typical of any credit-driven boom and bust cycle. But Xi’s support for Putin’s war of choice in Ukraine renders any course correction more difficult to engineer.

title: Photos of Derna’s Devastation: How Libya Fell Victim to a Most Unnatural Disaster
description: The thousands dead after Libya’s flooding may, officially, be recorded as victims of an act of God. But if anything is clear in the last days of the incendiary summer of 2023, it’s that human decisions factored in every life lost.
